FuncDef: The display device ap-id command displays basic information of all operating devices. The information includes the power and fan module information.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the AP device.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Examples: Slot #   Type    Online     Register     Status     Role   LsId   Primary
1        PIC     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
2        PIC     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
3        PIC     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
5        PIC     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
8        PIC     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
9        IPU     Present    Registered   Normal     MMB    0      Master
10       IPU     Present    Registered   Normal     MMB    0      Slave
11       PWR     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
12       PWR     Present    Registered   Abnormal   OTHER  0      NA
13       FAN     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      NA
14       CLK     Present    Registered   Normal     OTHER  0      Master
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a board is faulty or in device routine maintenance, the display device ap-id command can be used to display information about the board or module. For example, you can view the running status of the board, power module, or fan module. The information helps you check whether the device is running properly.
Precautions
After the fault is rectified, run the display device ap-id command to view the hardware status and the registration status. The information helps you check whether the faulty component is recovered and running properly.
